info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of northwestern Otero and east central Sierra Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Three Rivers to 19 miles north of Northrup Landing. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. Outflow ahead of the storms may produce strong wind gusts. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Three Rivers, Tularosa and Three Rivers Petroglyph Site. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 75 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
